intro: Mascagnia cordifolia subsp. thiantha, commonly known as the heartleaf mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes plants with milky sap and often showy flowers. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
